alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Grainger; Hamblen; Jefferson; Knox; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 4:28PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Claiborne, Grainger, Hamblen, Jefferson, Knox and Union. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms during the past hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area during the next hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Knoxville, Morristown, Jefferson City, Maynardville, Rutledge, New Tazewell, Bean Station, Tazewell, Plainview, New Market, Strawberry Plains, Blaine, Luttrell, Joppa, Buffalo Springs, Rose Hill, House Mountain State Park, Lone Mountain, Sandlick and Mascot. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Claiborne; Grainger; Hamblen; Jefferson; Knox; Union
